headline: Analysis: Activist investors set to push for changes as dealmaking picks up
summary: NEW YORK/FRANKFURT (Reuters) -Activist shareholders are poised to push harder for corporate changes in the coming months, finding fresh confidence to launch campaigns as the pace of dealmaking picks up again.  Bankers, lawyers, and investors forecast a spike in fights over corporate leadership, operational improvements and spin-offs in the second half of 2025.  Many global corporations will gird for costly and time-consuming battles, they said, even as some activist investors may be willing to compromise.
